PERSONA:
Name: Mark Thompson 
Age: 62 years 
Sex: Male 
Race: White 
Ethnicity: Not Applicable 
Location: Cheyenne, Wyoming, residing in the historic downtown area with a mix of old and new homes. 

Marital Status: Married to his high school sweetheart, Karen, for 38 years. They have two adult children, both of whom have moved out of the house and are pursuing their careers in other states.

Education: Mark is a high school graduate from Cheyenne East High School. He did not attend college but has received vocational training in mechanics and automotive repair.

Employment Status: Mark is employed as a full-time mechanic at a local car repair shop in Cheyenne, where he has worked for over 20 years. His annual income is $55,000. He is the primary breadwinner in the household, as Karen works part-time as a librarian.

Household Details: Mark owns a single-family home in the downtown area, which he and Karen purchased in 1995 for $120,000. The house has appreciated in value over the years and is now worth around $280,000. They have a mortgage of $180,000 and make monthly payments of $900.

Economic Concerns: Mark's primary economic concerns are related to retirement and healthcare. As he approaches retirement age, he worries about having enough savings to support himself and Karen. He is also concerned about the rising costs of healthcare and the potential impact of policy changes on their access to medical care.

Language and Citizenship: Mark speaks English fluently and has never spoken any other language at home. He is a US citizen by birth and has lived in Wyoming his entire life.

Assumptions: 
- Based on Mark's occupation and location, it is assumed that he is likely to be conservative in his economic views, possibly leaning towards Republican, but with a strong sense of community and social responsibility.
- Given his age and occupation, Mark may prioritize healthcare and retirement security in his economic and political views.
